I circulate draft instructions which have been prepared in the Ministry of Defence and which have been telegraphed to theMinister in Paris for his approval.(Signed) NORMAN brook cabinet Office, S.W.I.14th April, 1958-It-top secret " DRAFT instructions for Commander from Chiefs of StaffMinisters have now sanctioned an extension of the existingauthority regarding counter-battery action across the Yemeni frontier,as follows.2. At your discretion and subject to the limitations inparagraphs 3 and 4 below you may authorise retaliatory attacks against guns, including those sited in inhabited villages, whichfire:-(a) On ground targets in Aden territory.(b) On our aircraft flying on our side of the border.(c) On our aircraft flying across the border onauthorised counter-battery action.3. There must be no bombing (repeat) no bombing of gunssited in inhabited villages. Retaliatory air attacks against suchguns to be limited to precision rocket and cannon fire attacks.4. Retaliatory action to be limited to field guns and A. A. gunswhich have opened fire. Suspected gun positions are not to be attacked.-2-
